PAD2007 - Introduction to Leadership and.name: PAD2007 - Introduction to Leadership and Public Service: A Central Florida Experience

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theoretical approaches to leadership that can be applied to a variety of careers focusing on public service in Central Florida and the downtown Orlando community.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

PAD3003 - Public Administration in Ameri.name: PAD3003 - Public Administration in American Society

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: C- or better in POS 2041; and Public Administration major or Public Administration minor or Leadership Studies minor or Performing Arts Administration minor; and Sophomore standing; or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An examination of the basic environment, culture, and organization of public administration in the United States.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

PAD3040 - Ethics and Values in Public Ad.name: PAD3040 - Ethics and Values in Public Administration

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing; and Public Administration major or declared Leadership Studies Certificate or declared Leadership Studies minor; or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Ethical dimensions of public administration. Develops the awareness, skills, and value framework to act ethically.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing; and Urban and Regional Planning minor, or Interdisciplinary Studies Environmental Studies Track major, or Environmental Studies minor; or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Planning topics such as landuse, and comprehensive and urban planning as they relate to the physical aspects of the natural and human environment.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

PAD3733 - Professional Administrative Wr.name: PAD3733 - Professional Administrative Writing in the Public Sector

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: C- or better in ENC 1102; Sophomore standing, Public Administration major, or Nonprofit Management Major, or Emergency Management Major, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Professional and technical writing for the field of public administration.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

PAD4034 - The Administration of Public P.name: PAD4034 - The Administration of Public Policy

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing, and either a Public Administration major or Public Adminstration minor with a "C-" or better in PAD 3003, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Problems of values, interests, and objectives and their impact on the administration of public programs, stressing the interplay between social values, policies and administration.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: C- or better in ENC 1102, Junior standing, and either a Public Administration major, or Public Administration minor, or Nonprofit Management major, or Nonprofit Management Minor,  or Emergency Management Major, or Leadership Studies minor or certificate, Applied Science, A.S. to B.A.S. or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A review of the behavioral aspects of the administrative process, its impact on organizational goal achievement and on supervisory strategies. Some social and structural pathologies affecting administrative practice.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior Standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Various approaches to managing projects, including using scheduling techniques such as GANTT, CPM, and PERT, as well as team building, facilitating, and leadership skills.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and declared Nonprofit Major or Minor, or Performing Arts Management minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The operations of nonprofit organizations, including working with board of directors, volunteer services, fund-raising and grantsmanship, financial management and marketing.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing, and Nonprofit Managment major or Nonprofit Management minor, or Performing Arts Administration minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of the development and management of human resources and financial resource development in nonprofit organizations is discussed.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing, and Nonprofit Management major or Nonprofit Management minor, or Performing Arts Administration minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of recruitment, selection, training and management of volunteers in nonprofit organizations and the application of management theory.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and Nonprofit Management Major, or Nonprofit Management minor or certificate, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Prepare future leaders for the changing paradigms of the public sector by providing education in a variety of quality related areas.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: "C-" or better in ENC 1102, Junior standing, and either a Public Administration major, or Public Administration minor, or Nonprofit Management major, or Nonprofit Management minor, or Emergency Management major, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of methods of securing public funds, the process of budget making, and techniques of management used in managing public funds.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: PAD 4204 or C.I.

Course Description.text: Analytical skills and administrative techniques employed by public budget analysis, focusing on the process of generating and using information.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Emergency Management Major, or Non Profit minor, or Urban Regional Planning minor, and Junior standing, or C.I.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and (declared nonprofit minor or declared Nonprofit Management major) or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: To develop an understanding of program evaluation and to apply the process by developing a program evaluation for a program.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and Urban and Regional Planning minor; or C.I.

Course Description.text: The study of land use and planning to include zoning variances, non-conformities, development agreements, subdivision controls, redevelopment and sprawl.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and Urban and Regional Planning minor, or C.I.

Course Description.text: Theories and concepts of the physical, cultural, social and financial factors associated with urban design.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

PAD4351 - Issues in Environmental Progra.name: PAD4351 - Issues in Environmental Program Management

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing, and Urban and Regional Planning minor, or Interdisciplinary Studies Environmental Studies Track major, or Environmental Studies minor, or Energy and Sustainability minor, or Emergency Mangement Major, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The study of environmental policy making processes, programs, and problems through lectures, field study, and research projects.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: PAD 4390 and PAD 4392, and Junior Standing and declared Emergency Managment Major or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Issues of community resiliency & sustainability specific to emergency & crisis management. Includes coverage of public policy & management, urban planning & development, and community sociology.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and Emergency Management Major, or Emergency Management and Homeland Security minor, or Urban and Regional Planning minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Specialized knowledge and skills necessary to develop a proactive hazard mitigation plan to reduce the effects of natural and technological disasters.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

PAD4392 - Emergency Management and Homel.name: PAD4392 - Emergency Management and Homeland Security

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and Emergency Management Major, or Emergency Management and Homeland Security minor, or Urban and Regional Planning minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: After a public emergency, a variety of services must be provided to the victims. This course reviews and analyzes coordination and management of these services.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and Emergency Management major, or Emergency Management and Homeland Security minor, or Urban and Regional Planning minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Individual, group, organizations and community behavior and recovery from disasters. Service delivery strategies are highlighted and complex dynamics of the recovery process are emphasized.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Either a Public Administration major with a "C-" or better in PAD 3003, or Administration minor with a "C-" or better in PAD 3003, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The history, operating components, structural characteristics, and increasing impact of laws and related sanctions on personnel practices of public agencies.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: CCIE major or minor, and Junior standing, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course is designed to help public managers examine public and personal attitudes and values, ethical dilemmas, and social consequences related to issues of diversity.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and Emergency Management major, or Emergency Management and Homeland Security minor or Urban and Regional Planning minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Knowledge and skills concerning information technologies important for planners and public managers, including use of GIS to manipulate and analyze spatial data.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to the concepts, design, methodology, computer applications, and data analysis in applied research in the public sector.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and Urban and Regional Planning minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: To provide students with an understanding of public policy and administrative responses to socioeconomic problems within the urban context.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Junior standing and Public Administration major, or Public Administration minor, or Emergency Management major, or Emergency Management and Homeland Security minor or Urban and Regional Planning minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Various approaches to studying and explaining the American intergovernmental system. Emphasis on interorganizational activities, i.e., negotiation, cooperation, and coordination within the legal setting.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites.text: PR: Public Administration major, Senior Standing, PAD 4034, PAD 4104, and PAD 4131

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Through this capstone experience, students will develop competencies as managerial leaders, learn about the major theoretical frameworks, and prepare themselves and others for public service.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

PAD4933H - Planning and Policy Perspecti.name: PAD4933H - Planning and Policy Perspectives on Everglades Restoration

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission into the Honors College for the first three years. C- or better in ENC 1102

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Ecosystem restoration program from planning, policy, and management perspective. Policy history of Central/South Florida Flood Control Project, development of Comprehensive Everglades Restoration Program.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Discussion and activity based course exploring nonprofit competencies to prepare students for management and leadership positions in nonprofit organizations. Service learning activities included.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Public service organizations internship in public/nonprofit sectors (private sector on case by case basis). Demonstrate competencies in discipline through practical experiences and portfolio building project.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

PAD4942 - School of Public Administratio.name: PAD4942 - School of Public Administration Internship Orientation

Course Description.text: This course is designed to equip students with the tools they will need for a smooth transition into their chosen internship.
